High volume of write/overwrite events to.Data: Windows Event ID 4663, Windows Event ID 5140, Windows Event ID 4688
High volume of write/overwrite events to.Action: Collect Windows Event IDs 4663 (write), 5140 (share access), and 4688 (process creation). Analyze write event volume per process/user/source host to shared directories. Identify processes or hosts with write volumes significantly higher than their historical baseline or the median/average using statistical methods (e.g., z-score, IQR). Flag write events occurring outside normal business hours or from unusual processes for investigation.

Detection of processes executing from ne.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 5140, Zeek conn.log
Detection of processes executing from ne.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for processes executing from network shared drives. Analyze process command lines and parent processes. Correlate with file access/share access logs (Event ID 5140) to understand context. Identify processes executed from shares that exhibit suspicious child processes, network connections (Zeek conn.log), or unusual behavior using correlation analysis. Look for patterns indicative of unexpected execution from shared locations.
